meanings.definition: The act or process of releasing pressure or reducing compression.
meanings.sent1: After a deep-sea dive, the diver needed decompression to avoid getting the bends.
meanings.sent2: The scuba divers underwent decompression to safely return to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The submarine had to undergo decompression before the crew could exit safely.
meanings.sent4: The decompression of the cabin allowed the passengers to breathe more easily.
meanings.sent5: The decompression chamber slowly equalized the pressure for the diver.
